name: Daniel Kudwien
bio:
Creating web platforms with @makers99. Creating new jobs with @netzstrategen.
Contributing to @WordPress and @drupal.

top_projects.name: jquery-form-submit-single
top_projects.description: Prevents consecutive form submissions of identical form values.

top_projects.name: innerXHTML
top_projects.description: A replacement for innerHTML() to parse and write DOM elements.

top_projects.name: google-firebase-firestore-json-export
top_projects.description: Exports all firebase collections into local JSON files.

top_projects.name: staticreflection
top_projects.description: Static PHP class code reflection for post-discovery scenarios.

top_projects.name: quickstart-php-package
top_projects.description: Quickstart guide for creating PHP packages.

top_projects.name: ezmollom
top_projects.description: This extension is based Mollom's REST API, which was suppose to replace the XML-RPC API in  2011. However, the Mollom REST API is still in beta. Therefore we recommend not to use the  eZ Mollom on production sites until further notice. If you wish to be notified when the  eZ Mollom extension is available for production sites, please send a mail to info@fumaggo.com.  In the mean time we will continue development on the eZ Mollom extension.

makers99/wp-cli-shared-patches.summary: Recent activities involved resolving fatal errors and optimizing existing patches. A pull request was merged on November 28, 2024 to address a fatal error in a Woocommerce template, while an earlier push on October 21, 2024, removed an already resolved patch named 'gwconditionallogicdates'.

profile_summary:
Daniel Kudwien is a highly skilled and accomplished web developer with extensive proficiency in PHP, Python, and JavaScript. As a seasoned expert with a strong track record of creating cutting-edge web platforms, he brings a wealth of knowledge and expertise to the table. His impressive portfolio boasts 56 public repositories, a testament to his active involvement in various development projects and his passion for staying at the forefront of the industry.

With over 80 followers, Daniel has established himself as a respected and influential figure in the developer community. His notable contributions to prominent platforms such as WordPress and Drupal demonstrate his commitment to collaboration and innovation. As a dedicated professional, Daniel continues to push the boundaries of web development, creating new opportunities and driving growth with his work at Makers99 and Netzstrategen. His exceptional technical skills, coupled with his strong industry connections and dedication to delivering high-quality solutions, make him a valuable asset to any development team or project.
